Key Match Events: West Indies won by 9 wickets (with 17 balls remaining).
Pre-Game Insights: Experts noted contrasting disappointments at the T20 World Cup as new-look teams build for the next event.
Jason Roy scored a blistering 36-ball hundred in England's warm-up match against a Board President's XI.
Phil Salt admitted to ESPNcricinfo that he had been underwhelmed by his England debut in Cardiff last year.
Nicholas Pooran's time is now, with the passing of an irreplaceable generation in the West Indies team.
Post-Match Reflections: Phil Simmons believes his side has plenty of room for improvement.
Jason Roy has high expectations from one of his potential opening partners.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kensington Oval will be limited to 50% capacity due to Covid restrictions.
This will be the first time that Barbados has hosted international cricket since becoming a republic in November last year.
England have won four and lost two of their six previous T20Is in Barbados.
Bridgetown is the venue for England's World T20 final victory over Australia in 2010, their first piece of global silverware.
